page.title: 03The A69 at Haltwhistle.
page.content: The A69 runs through Haltwhistle. The Main Street is bypassed but the West End is not. A lot of traffic goes along the road. Our class carried out a{traffic census}on Thursday 27th June 1985 from 11am to 11.15am and 152 vehicles passed us at the Station Corner. People who live in the West End of Haltwhistle think there is too much traffic. In some places the road is only 6.65 metres wide and the big vehicles have to mount the narrow pavement when they want to pass. It is very dangerous if you are walking on the pathway. They want a new{bypass}to be built and they have formed an Action Committee to try to make the Government build the by pass at the south side of Haltwhistle instead of widening the present road.
